title: Visual difference between a open nexus and a defended nexus?
body: So I had a thought as I was thinking about the new map, and something that pops up on occasion is an inhib respawns behind the nexus and it suddenly just loses its health and can't be attacked. Is this different in the VU? Like does it look more protected when compared to an open nexus? Or do you feel that health above the base is enough. It'd be a nice future touch at the very least :)

replies.body: Good suggestion, I'll bounce it on to the SR team in case it's not something they're already looking.

It makes intuitive sense for there to be two inhibitor-related visuals above the nexus:

* an aura/barrier covering the entire nexus to represent all inhibitors and nexus turrets up; ie, the nexus is not attackable 

* 3 subtle visual indicators above the nexus, geometrically positioned in sync with the lanes, to show which inhibitors are alive

If done artfully, this will make sieging more understandable to new players, it will look awesome, and it will improve readability.

I really do suggest taking a look at [this post](http://community.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/summoners-rift/4c2oiwf1-give-the-inhibitors-a-meaning) as a viable option in accomplishing your second goal.

I personally hope that Riot seriously considers to implement something like this. I think that the base on the new SR looks a bit empty and this would be a great way to create a more intense feeling when entering the enemys base. {{summoner:4}}
[Here](http://community.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/summoners-rift/4c2oiwf1-give-the-inhibitors-a-meaning) is a wonderful suggestion on how to possibly implement this.
I actually like this idea. It would help identify when a nexus is able to be attacked, and I imagine wouldn't be -too- difficult to implement a red or blue shield around the floating crystal.

I'd love to see this on live, a visual showing that the nexus can't be attacked until the towers and at least one inhibitor are destroyed. I'd like the same for inner turrets before you destroy outer ones and for inhibitors before you destroy their respective turrets.
What happened to the summoners on the nexus in game?
